meanings.definition: An illustration or decorative design facing the title page of a book.
meanings.sent1: The frontispiece of the book showed a beautiful drawing of a castle.
meanings.sent2: The frontispiece of the novel featured a colorful map of the fictional world.
meanings.sent3: The frontispiece of the cookbook had a funny cartoon of a chef juggling vegetables.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a frontispiece, drawing everyone's attention as soon as she entered the room.
meanings.sent5: The frontispiece of the magazine was so striking that it stayed in my mind for days.

meanings.definition: A decorative facade or front of a building.
meanings.sent1: The frontispiece of the museum was adorned with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent2: The frontispiece of the theater was grand and imposing, welcoming the audience.
meanings.sent3: The frontispiece of the house had a quirky door knocker shaped like a lion's head.
meanings.sent4: The frontispiece of the church gleamed in the sunlight, a beacon of hope for the townspeople.
meanings.sent5: The frontispiece of the mansion was so elegant that it made passersby stop and admire.
